file.create.name: file.create
file.create.title: Initialize File
file.create.description: Create a new source file from scratch. Automatically handles directory creation, package boilerplate, and import organization.
file.create.instruction:
*   **`file.create`**: Initialize a new file. Essential for adding new modules or entry points.
    *   **Usage:** `file.create(name="cmd/main.go", content="package main\n...")`
    *   **Outcome:** File is created and formatted to standard.

file.edit.name: file.edit
file.edit.title: Patch File
file.edit.description: Perform a targeted code modification. Uses fuzzy-matching to locate and patch specific logic blocks, or appends new code if no context is provided. Always verifies syntax integrity before saving.
file.edit.instruction:
*   **`file.edit`**: Modify or extend existing logic. The primary tool for bug fixes and refactoring.
    *   **Modify:** `file.edit(file="main.go", search_context="func old() {\n}", replacement="func new() {\n}")`
    *   **Append:** `file.edit(file="main.go", replacement="func newFunc() {\n}")` (Leave `search_context` empty)
    *   **Outcome:** Code is updated and pre-verified for build safety.

file.outline.name: file.outline
file.outline.title: Scan Structure
file.outline.description: Examine the structural layout of a file. Returns imports, types, and function signatures. Use this to orient yourself without consuming large amounts of context.
file.outline.instruction:
*   **`file.outline`**: Perform a quick structural scan. Perfect for assessing a file's responsibilities.
    *   **Usage:** `file.outline(file="pkg/service.go")`
    *   **Outcome:** Lightweight structural map of the file.

file.read.name: file.read
file.read.title: Examine Content
file.read.description: Perform a deep read of a file. Returns the full source code and a detailed symbol table of all declarations. Use this when implementation details are required.
file.read.instruction:
*   **`file.read`**: Deep-dive into a file's implementation.
    *   **Usage:** `file.read(file_path="pkg/utils.go")`
    *   **Outcome:** Complete implementation source and symbol index.

file.list.name: file.list
file.list.title: Survey Directory
file.list.description: Explore the project hierarchy recursively. Use this to locate modules, understand the architecture, and find relevant source files.
file.list.instruction:
*   **`file.list`**: Map the project territory.
    *   **Usage:** `file.list(path=".", depth=2)`
    *   **Outcome:** Hierarchical list of files and directories.

symbol.inspect.name: symbol.inspect
symbol.inspect.title: Diagnose Symbol
symbol.inspect.description: Perform a deep-dive analysis of a specific symbol. Resolves its exact definition, documentation, and references using the project knowledge graph. Essential for assessing usage and impact.
symbol.inspect.instruction:
*   **`symbol.inspect`**: Get the ground truth for a symbol.
    *   **Usage:** `symbol.inspect(package="fmt", symbol="Println")` or `symbol.inspect(file="main.go", symbol="MyFunc")`
    *   **Outcome:** Source definition and comprehensive metadata for the symbol.

symbol.rename.name: symbol.rename
symbol.rename.title: Refactor Symbol
symbol.rename.description: Execute a safe, semantic rename of a Go identifier. Updates all call sites and references throughout the codebase to maintain structural integrity.
symbol.rename.instruction:
*   **`symbol.rename`**: Safely update a symbol's identity across the entire project.
    *   **Usage:** `symbol.rename(file="pkg/user.go", line=10, col=5, new_name="Customer")`
    *   **Outcome:** Semantic renaming with zero broken references.

project.map.name: project.map
project.map.title: Assess Architecture
project.map.description: Generates a hierarchical map of the project structure, listing all local packages and their files, as well as a summary of external dependencies.
project.map.instruction:
*   **`project.map`**: Get the high-level project structure.
    *   **Usage:** `project.map()`
    *   **Outcome:** A complete architectural map of the repository files and packages.

go.docs.name: go.docs
go.docs.title: Consult Docs
go.docs.description: Query Go documentation for any package or symbol in the ecosystem. Supports standard library and third-party modules. Essential for learning API usage.
go.docs.instruction:
*   **`go.docs`**: Consult the documentation library.
    *   **Usage:** `go.docs(package_path="net/http")`
    *   **Outcome:** API reference and usage guidance.

go.build.name: go.build
go.build.title: Go Build
go.build.description: Compiles the packages named by the import paths, along with their dependencies. Generates an executable binary if `main` package is targeted.
go.build.instruction:
*   **`go.build`**: Compile the project to check for errors.
    *   **Usage:** `go.build(packages=["./..."])`
    *   **Outcome:** Build status report (Success or Error Log).

go.test.name: go.test
go.test.title: Run Tests
go.test.description: Execute the test suite to verify logical correctness. Supports package-level testing and regex filtering for specific test cases.
go.test.instruction:
*   **`go.test`**: Verify logic and prevent regressions.
    *   **Usage:** `go.test(packages=["./pkg/..."], run="TestAuth")`
    *   **Outcome:** Test execution report (PASS/FAIL).

go.install.name: go.install
go.install.title: Go Install
go.install.description: Compiles and installs the package/binary to `$GOPATH/bin`. Use this to install tools or the current project.
go.install.instruction:
*   **`go.install`**: Add new tools or dependencies.
    *   **Usage:** `go.install(packages=["golang.org/x/tools/cmd/goimports@latest"])`
    *   **Outcome:** Successful installation of the target package.

go.get.name: go.get
go.get.title: Go Get
go.get.description: Downloads and installs the packages named by the import paths, along with their dependencies. Updates `go.mod`.
go.get.instruction:
*   **`go.get`**: Add a new dependency to the module.
    *   **Usage:** `go.get(packages=["github.com/gin-gonic/gin@latest"])`
    *   **Outcome:** Module added to go.mod and downloaded.

go.mod.name: go.mod
go.mod.title: Go Mod
go.mod.description: Provides access to module maintenance operations like `go mod tidy`.
go.mod.instruction:
*   **`go.mod`**: Manage module requirements.
    *   **Usage:** `go.mod(command="tidy")`
    *   **Outcome:** go.mod and go.sum are updated/cleaned.

go.modernize.name: go.modernize
go.modernize.title: Modernize Code
go.modernize.description: Analyze and automatically upgrade legacy Go patterns to modern standards. Replaces outdated constructs with performant, modern equivalents.
go.modernize.instruction:
*   **`go.modernize`**: Proactively upgrade legacy patterns.
    *   **Usage:** `go.modernize(dir=".", fix=true)`
    *   **Outcome:** Clean, modern Go source code.

go.diff.name: go.diff
go.diff.title: Assess API Risk
go.diff.description: Compare the public API of two versions of a package. Detects breaking changes and incompatible updates using `apidiff`.
go.diff.instruction:
*   **`go.diff`**: Perform a risk assessment for updates.
    *   **Usage:** `go.diff(old="v1.0.0", new=".")`
    *   **Outcome:** Report on incompatible API changes.

agent.review.name: agent.review
agent.review.title: Request Review
agent.review.description: Submit code for expert analysis. Returns a structured critique focusing on correctness, idiomatic style, and potential edge cases.
agent.review.instruction:
*   **`agent.review`**: Get an expert peer review.
    *   **Usage:** `agent.review(file_content="...")`
    *   **Outcome:** Actionable suggestions and bug findings.

agent.specialist.name: agent.specialist
agent.specialist.title: Consult Specialist
agent.specialist.description: Delegate complex investigation to a specialized autonomous agent. The specialist can independently research the codebase to answer difficult architectural questions.
agent.specialist.instruction:
*   **`agent.specialist`**: Ask a question requiring deep research.
    *   **Usage:** `agent.specialist(query="How does the auth flow handle token expiry?")`
    *   **Outcome:** Comprehensive investigative report.

agent.master.name: agent.master
agent.master.title: Master Gopher
agent.master.description: Consult the Master Gopher for strategic guidance. The lead analyzes your task and dynamically unlocks the tools you need to succeed.
agent.master.instruction:
*   **`agent.master`**: Get help with tool selection and strategy.
    *   **Usage:** `agent.master(query="I need to refactor the user service.")`
    *   **Outcome:** Guidance and dynamic tool enablement.
